alert.note: Alert for Meigs (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 08 at 10:18AM EST until March 09 at 6:08AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by runoff from yesterday`s rain continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Ohio, including the following county, Meigs. * WHEN...Until 345 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of the Shade River is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1014 AM EST, The automated gauge on the Shade River near Chester reported a reading of 18.31 feet and slowly rising. At 17 feet, the Sugar Run Creek Bridge is flooded 200 feet downstream from Oak Hill Road and the Shade River Bridge. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chester. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
